p.font: Quick & lightweight service for distributed computing

div.div: Fast access data cache, likely Redis

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 332px; height: 1px; padding-top: 130px; margin-left: 16px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; max-height: 450px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.p: The idea is to create a "chat room" for programs. Essentially, clients will be able to generate a websocket room at distri.domain/r/hashednewroomURL.

Users would then be able to connect to this room via browser (for manual GUI viewing of the room data) as well as programmatically (receiving/updating remote data from code). Data will be stored in a key:value dictionary.

ul.li: Intended for usage in quick scripts and small projects
Intended for code handling non-sensitive data
Python Flask for quick development & socketio support
Bootstrap for frontend styling and visuals

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 172px; height: 1px; padding-top: 5px; margin-left: 520px;
